Kanban board. Extended version
The
Kanban board
is used for visualization, optimization and workflow efficiency improvement.
Planning using the
extended version Kanban board
provides multi-level task flow representation, allowing visual tracking of task statuses at different stages, in different categories and groups.
Example of configured extended version Kanban board:
Three organization levels are used for visualization:
stages
- vertical columns displaying different work stages;
swimlanes
- horizontal rows used to split tasks into different categories, teams or work types;
groups
- combination of stages/swimlanes by certain attributes, for example by priority, client or project.
A simplified workflow visualization and management option, focused on main process stages without additional organization levels, may be configured using
"Kanban board" analytics dashboard
.
Setting up
Creating, configuring and working with the Kanban board is performed through
registry
, which can be opened by sequentially selecting
main menu items
: "Reports" → "Kanban board. Extended version".
For
creating and configuring
a Kanban board, the user must be granted appropriate access permissions.

By default, permissions to create and edit Kanban boards are granted to users added to the
system access group
"Administrative group" [ROLE_ADMIN].
In the "Kanban board" object registry, creation of a new object is performed via the
button in the control panel. When clicked, a new tab opens with the object ready for configuration.
The object name is specified in the control panel field. Access to the Kanban board settings is achieved by clicking the
button in the control panel or in the
workspace
.
When opening an existing Kanban board object, settings become available after switching to edit mode by clicking the
button in the control panel or in the
workspace
profile.
Configuring a Kanban board requires completing two stages:
Defining
configuration parameters
followed by saving the object.
Creating, configuring and arranging stages, swimlanes and their grouping (details in
"Building the Kanban Board"
section).
Configuration Parameters
When navigating to settings via the
button, a modal window will open containing the following parameter groups organized in tabs:
Basic Settings
Display Settings
WIP Limits
[
1
]
Filtering
Sortings
Basic settings
Setting
Purpose
General Settings of Kanban Board
Kanban board Object Type
The object type whose data will be displayed as task profiles on the Kanban board.
The object type is selected from a dropdown list of pre-created types or can be created using the "Add" option available in the context menu after clicking the actions menu in the right part of the parameter field.
The full list of types in the parameter’s drop-down list becomes available after clicking the "Show all types" button
. This button is displayed if the user has the "Run" permission for
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
.
This field is required.
Attribute for stage separation
The attribute used to distribute tasks across stages (columns).
Selection is made from a dropdown list of
object attributes
(including inherited ones) of the object type specified in the "Kanban Board Object Type" parameter.
This field is required.
Cell height
The height of the area containing task cards.
If tasks don’t fit within the container’s visible area, vertical scrolling becomes available.
Accepts integer values from 50 to 10000 (inclusive).
Default value is 200.
Card opening method
Method for opening Kanban board object (task) cards.
Available options:
In modal window;
In new window;
In current window.
Default value is "In modal window".
Attribute for swimlane separation
The attribute used to distribute tasks across swimlanes (rows).
Selection is made from a dropdown list of
object attributes
(including inherited ones) of the object type specified in the "Kanban Board Object Type" parameter.
This field is required.
Attribute for group of stages separation
The attribute for grouping stages.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of
object attributes
of the object type referenced by the attribute specified in the "Attribute for stage separation" parameter.
The directory values of the selected object attribute will be available for selection when configuring stage grouping, enabling synchronization of task profile placement changes between the Kanban board and objects of the attribute type selected for stage grouping.
If the parameter value is not specified, stage grouping can be configured on the Kanban board, but these changes won’t be synchronized with corresponding system objects.
This field is available when the "Attribute for stage separation" parameter is filled in.
Attribute for group of swimlanes separation
The attribute for grouping swimlanes.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of
object attributes
of the object type referenced by the attribute specified in the "Attribute for swimlane separation" parameter.
The directory values of the selected object attribute will be available for selection when configuring swimlane grouping, enabling synchronization of task card placement changes between the Kanban board and objects of the attribute type selected for swimlane grouping.
If the parameter value is not specified, swimlane grouping can be configured on the Kanban board, but these changes won’t be synchronized with corresponding system objects.
This field is available when the "Attribute for swimlane separation" parameter is filed in.
Number of cards to be loaded
The quantity of task cards displayed in cells during initial interface loading.
When the number of tasks in a cell exceeds the specified value, vertical scrolling becomes available. Scrolling triggers incremental loading of tasks according to the parameter value.
Accepts integer values from 50 to 100 (inclusive).
Default value is 5.
Display the number of cards in each cell
Indicator showing the number of cards in a cell.
When enabled, each cell’s header displays the count of contained task cards.
Customizing card attributes
Adding attributes whose values will be displayed on task cards.
Clicking the button adds a selection area for choosing an attribute to be placed on the task card.
Example of task card display:
The task name appears as a hyperlink that opens the task card when clicked.
The card opening method is controlled by the corresponding parameter in the "Kanban Board General Settings" section.
Attribute display settings can be edited by clicking the
icon.
The modal window that opens contains the following attribute configuration parameters:
Setting
Purpose
General attribute settings
Attribute
Selecting an attribute to display in the task card.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of all attributes (including inherited ones) of the object type specified in the "Kanban Board Object Type" parameter.
Attribute display style
Title
Entering the attribute title to display in the task card.
By default, the field is filled in by attribute name.
Display title
Parameter determining whether to display the attribute title in the card.
Display chat button
Parameter controlling display of a chat icon which, when clicked, opens the
web messenger
in the bottom right corner of the screen for discussing the configured attribute with users.
Available for
object attributes
of type "Personal data" [SYS_EMPLOYEE] or inherited from it.
Display photo
Parameter controlling display of the user profile icon for the configured attribute.
Available for
object attributes
of type "Personal data" [SYS_EMPLOYEE] or inherited from it.
Display as hyperlink
Parameter controlling whether to display the attribute value as a hyperlink that navigates to the attribute object type instance when clicked.
Available for
object attributes
except those of type "Personal data" [SYS_EMPLOYEE].
Style
Selecting the attribute display style.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of predefined
formatting styles
. New styles can be added via the parameter’s action menu.
Currently, when selecting a style for attribute display, only font size and text formatting (bold, italic, underlined) are applied.
The attribute order can be changed using the
icon via the Drag&Drop method.
Attributes are removed by clicking the
icon.
By default, this section contains the "ID" and "Name" attributes with preconfigured display parameters, enabling immediate viewing of the ready analytical panel.
Display Settings
The tab settings serve to define task styling formats based on expected and actual completion dates.
Setting
Purpose
Styles of design
Expected completion date
Selecting an attribute containing the expected task completion date.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of "Date" and "Date/time" type attributes (including inherited ones) of the object type specified in the "Kanban Board Object Type" parameter on the "Basic Settings" tab.
Actual completion date
Selecting an attribute defining the actual task completion date.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of "Date" and "Date/time" type attributes (including inherited ones) of the object type specified in the "Kanban Board Object Type" parameter on the "Basic Settings" tab.
Task created
Selecting
formatting style
to be applied to tasks:
When
no
expected/actual completion date parameters are specified;
When both conditions are met:
The task
doesn’t have
a value in the attribute selected as the "Actual completion date" parameter.
The task isn’t due yet (current datetime is
earlier
than the "Expected completion date" parameter value plus the "Expiration value" (considering the "Expiration type" parameter)).
Selecting from a dropdown list of predefined
formatting styles
; new styles can be added via the parameter’s action menu.
Default: "New task style".
Task completed
Selecting
formatting style
for tasks where the
actual completion date
parameter is filled in.
Selecting from a dropdown list of predefined
formatting styles
; new styles can be added via the parameter’s action menu.
Default: "Completed task style".
Available when the "Actual completion date" parameter is filled in.
Task overdue
Selecting
formatting style
applied when both conditions are met:
The task
doesn’t have
a value in the attribute selected as the "Actual completion date" parameter.
The task is overdue (current datetime is
later
than the "Expected completion date" parameter value).
Selecting from a dropdown list of predefined
formatting styles
; new styles can be added via the parameter’s action menu.
Default: "Overdue task style".
Available when the "Actual completion date" parameter is filled in.
Task deadline expires
Selecting
formatting style
applied when both conditions are met:
The task
doesn’t have
a value in the attribute selected as the "Actual completion date" parameter.
The task deadline is approaching (difference between current datetime and "Expected completion date" is
less
than the "Expiration value" (considering the "Expiration type" parameter)).
Selecting from a dropdown list of predefined
formatting styles
; new styles can be added via the parameter’s action menu.
Default value is "Approaching deadline task style".
Available when the "Actual completion date" parameter is filled in.
Expiration type
Determining the deadline calculation method.
Selecting from a dropdown list of "WF_TASK_TERM_TYPE" objects for
fixed deadlines
. Available options:
Fixed days;
Fixed minutes;
Fixed workdays;
Fixed work minutes;
Fixed work hours;
Fixed hours.
Default value is "Fixed days".
Expiration value
Specifying the deadline threshold according to the expiration type. Accepting integer values.
Default value is "0".
WIP limits
[
1
]
Using WIP limits
promotes more balanced task flow, increases overall workflow efficiency, and helps control the number of simultaneously processed tasks within each stage, swimlane, or group of stages/swimlanes.
This tab’s settings allow defining maximum and/or minimum task card quantities in cells.
If the limit is not met, a color indication will be applied to the current number of tasks and the limit of the corresponding item:
Green (#1DB577 HEX) appears when the task count falls below the lower limit
Pink (#F5347EEX) indicates when the upper limit is exceeded
By clicking on the
button, a form for setting the limit using the following parameters will open in the registry of the "WIP limits" attribute:
Setting
Purpose
Method of limit setting
Selecting the limit configuration method with two options:
Static setup;
Setup by algorithm.
Limits
Lower limit
Number defining the minimum allowed quantity of task cards for the configured item.
Accepts integer values from 0 to 100 (inclusive) that don’t exceed the upper limit (if specified).
At least one field ("Lower limit" or "Upper limit") must be filled in to save the limit.
Displayed for static limit setup.
Upper limit
Number defining the maximum allowed quantity of task cards for the configured item.
Accepts integer values from 0 to 100 (inclusive) that aren’t lower than the specified lower limit (if defined).
At least one field ("Lower limit" or "Upper limit") must be filled in to save the limit.
Displayed for static limit setup.
Algorithm for determining the lower limit
Algorithm calculating the minimum allowed quantity of task cards for the configured item.
Must return integer values from 0 to 100 (inclusive) that don’t exceed the upper limit (if specified). Returns no limit display if the value is outside this range.
At least one field ("Lower limit algorithm" or "Upper limit algorithm") must be file in to save the limit.
Displayed for algorithm-based limit setup.
Algorithm for determining the upper limit
Algorithm calculating the maximum allowed quantity of task cards for the configured item.
Must return integer values from 0 to 100 (inclusive) that aren’t lower than the specified lower limit (if defined).
At least one field ("Lower limit algorithm" or "Upper limit algorithm") must be filled in to save the limit.
Displayed for algorithm-based limit setup.
Stages
Selecting stages and/or stage groups for limit application.
Each item can have only one configured limit.
If there are already configured limits for the selected stages and/or groups of stages, then a modal window will open to confirm the replacement of the limit.
Swimlanes
Selecting swimlanes and/or swimlane groups for limit application.
Each item can have only one configured limit.
If there are already configured limits for the selected swimlanes/groups of swimlanes, then a modal window will open to confirm the replacement of the limit.
Filtering
The parameters of this tab enable data filtering configuration for task display and define filters available to users on the Kanban board.
Setting
Purpose
Filtering algorithm
Specifying the value filtering algorithm.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of pre-configured algorithms; creating new
algorithms
is available via the parameter’s action menu.
The dropdown list displays algorithms whose base object type matches or inherits from the type selected in the
"Kanban Board Object Type"
parameter.
Filter
Defining object filters based on
SQL conditions
.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of pre-configured filters; creating new filters is available via the parameter’s action menu.
The dropdown list displays filters whose base object type matches or inherits from the type selected in the
"Kanban Board Object Type"
parameter.
Additional attributes for filtering
Selecting attributes whose values will enable
task filtering
on the Kanban board.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of all attributes (including inherited ones) of the object type selected in the
"Kanban Board Object Type"
parameter.
The filtering configured for the Kanban board applies to all users.
Only users with Kanban board editing permissions can modify these filtering parameters.
Sortings
This tab sets the default task sorting rule on the Kanban board for all users, and also defines additional attributes for configuring
custom sorting
while working with the Kanban board.
The following parameters are used for this:
Setting
Purpose
Additional attributes for sorting
Selected attributes will be displayed when configuring
sorting on the Kanban board
.
Sortings
Configuring the default task sorting on the Kanban board for all users.
Sorting is configured by creating registry instances; details about the configuration parameters are described further.
Clicking the
button in the "Sorting" registry control panel will open a modal window where the following sorting parameters are defined:
Setting
Purpose
Stages
Selecting stages and/or stage groups for which sorting is configured.
To create a sorting, a sorting element must be specified – at least one of the fields: "Stages" or "Swimlanes" must be filled in.
Swimlanes
Selecting swimlanes and/or swimlane groups for which sorting is configured.
To create a sorting, a sorting element must be specified – at least one of the fields: "Stages" or "Swimlanes" must be filled in.
Orders
Defining sorting conditions for Kanban board elements specified in the "Stages" and "Swimlanes" fields.
Conditions are set by creating instances in the "Orders" registry. Clicking the
button opens a modal window where you need to specify:
attribute type – the attribute by which sorting is configured;
sorting direction – the direction of sorting (ascending or descending).
By default, sorting is performed in ascending order.
The order of created instances is determined automatically by the system. The sorting order can be changed using the
buttons in the registry control panel.
Building the Kanban Board
After the
basic configuration parameters
are set, the Kanban board can be formed using the buttons located in the upper-left area of the workspace.
If a stage is to be added first, the button in the lower area of the workspace can be clicked.
The swimlane add button is made available when the "Attribute for swimlane separation" parameter is filled in.
The stage/swimlane group add buttons are enabled when at least one stage/swimlane not included in any group exists.
To create a new stage, click the
button.
This will display a configuration area with the following stage parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the stage name for the Kanban board.
Defaults to the name of the first selected stage value.
Values
Selecting one or more flag that determine task placement in this stage.
Selection is made from a dropdown list of values from the attribute specified in the "Attribute for stage separation" field in settings.
The dropdown list only displays values not selected in other stages.
The Kanban board will display all instances of the type selected in the "Kanban Board Object Type" field where the stage separation attribute matches at least one of the selected values.
Position
Defining the need to display swimlanes in the added stage.
When choosing to display without swimlanes, the stage can only be positioned at the beginning or at the end of the customizable Kanban board.
The purpose of this parameter is to allow adding a stage without swimlane division for creating a backlog column.
Possible values:
With swimlanes;
Left without swimlanes;
Right without swimlanes.
The default value is set to "With swimlanes".
The parameter is displayed when there is at least one swimlane on the Kanban board.
After completing the configuration, click "OK" to add the new stage to the Kanban board with its associated object cards. Clicking "Cancel" will return the board to its original state.
To create a new swimlane, the
button must be clicked.
The swimlane addition button is enabled when the
Attribute for swimlane separation
parameter is filled in.
This action displays a configuration area with the following swimlane parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the swimlane display name.
Defaulting to the first selected value’s name.
Values
Selecting one or more flag for task placement in this swimlane.
Selecting from a dropdown list of the attribute specified in the
Attribute for swimlane separation
field.
The dropdown list only displays values not selected in other stages.
Showing all instances where the
Attribute for swimlane separation
matches at least one selected value.
When configuration is complete, the "OK" button must be clicked to add the swimlane with its associated cards. The "Cancel" button returns the board to its previous state.
To create a new group of stages, click the
button; for a group of swimlanes -
.
The group of stages/swimlanes addition buttons are only available when at least one stage/swimlane not added to any of the exiting group.
The following explains how to create the group of stages.
Group of swimlanes creating follows the same process.
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name for the group of stages.
Value
Selecting of one or more criteria for associating selected stages with the group of stages separation attribute.
If no value is selected, the group is created without attribute binding.
Values are selected from a dropdown list of the attribute specified in the
Attribute for group of stages separation
field.
The dropdown list shows only values not used in other groups of stages.
This field appears when the
Attribute for group of stages separation
parameter is filled in.
Stages
Specifying stages to include in the group.
The stages dropdown list displays only stages with selected values belonging to instances where the value of the
Attribute for group of stages separation
is among the group’s specified values or where no attribute value is specified.
Position
Defining the need to display swimlanes in the added stage group.
When choosing to display without swimlanes, the stage group can only be positioned at the beginning or at the end of the customizable Kanban board.
The purpose of this parameter is to allow adding a stage group without swimlane division for creating a backlog.
Possible values:
With swimlanes;
Left without swimlanes;
Right without swimlanes.
If the stage group is set to display without swimlanes, the same setting will be applied to all stages in that group.
The default value is set to "With swimlanes".
The parameter is displayed when configuring the stage group, and when there is at least one swimlane on the Kanban board.
Upon completing the configuration, click "OK" button; the new group of stages will be added to the Kanban board along with its related object cards. Clicking the "Cancel" button will return the board to its original state.
Each added stage, swimlane, or group of stages/swimlanes will display the
button. Clicking this button opens a dropdown menu with the following options:
1. Edit or delete the stage, swimlane, or group of stages/swimlanes.
The editing area allows modification of previously configured settings for the stage, swimlane, or group of stages/swimlanes. Changes are saved by clicking the "OK" button.
Deleting the stage, swimlane, or group of stages/swimlanes (when no dependencies exist) occurs immediately after clicking the
button.
Multiple items cannot be added or edited simultaneously.
Always complete configuration by clicking "OK", otherwise clicking another add/edit button will automatically cancel unsaved changes in the currently open editing area.
2. Configure WIP limits
[
1
]
for specific stages, swimlanes, or groups of stages/swimlanes.
If a limit has already been created for a stage, swimlanes, or group of stages/swimlanes, then user can either edit the current limit or create a new limit (instead of the current one):
When creating a new limit, the configured stage/swimlane/group of stages/group of swimlanes is automatically added to the "Stage"/"Swimlane" field. The remaining limit configuration process follows the same procedure as defined in the Kanban board settings in the
"WIP Limits"
tab.
Using the
button on Kanban board items creates new tasks with automatic assignment to the relevant stage, swimlane, and (when configured) the set group of stages/swimlanes.
For more convenience, cell contents can be collapsed.
Working with Kanban board
When working with a Kanban board, users can:
Create tasks
Move tasks
between cells using Drag&Drop
Filter task display
Sorting task cards
To work
with a configured Kanban board,
end users
must be granted the following access permissions:
Menu items "Reports" and "Kanban board. Extended version":
Read
Object type "Kanban board":
Read instances
Object type selected in the "Kanban Board Object Type" field during
configuration
:
Read instances
Custom widget "Kanban. Card attributes list":
Read
Object type "Kanban. Stage":
Read instances
Object type "Kanban. Swimlane":
Read instances
Object type "Kanban. Group of swimlanes":
Read instances
Object type "Formatting style and hints":
Read instances
Additionally, to move tasks between Kanban board items, permissions must be granted for:
The object type selected in the "Kanban Board Object Type" field during
configuration
:
Edit instances
Configured Kanban boards can be accessed via the
main menu item
.
Creating tasks
Tasks are created on the Kanban board by clicking the
button. New tasks will automatically be assigned to the relevant stage, swimlane, and (when
configured
) to the set group of stages/swimlanes.
When
WIP limits
are configured for an item (stage, swimlane, group of stages/swimlanes), the specified limits and current task count in the cell are displayed in the following format:
<Lower limit>/<Current task count>/<Upper limit>
The WIP limit allows highlighting when limits are exceeded by coloring both the current task count and the item limit using the default warning colors.
When kanban board filtering is active, limit violation highlighting only considers currently displayed (filtered) tasks.
For example, if the "Requirement: to do" stage exceeds its upper limit while "Requirement: done" falls below its lower limit, the display will appear as:
Moving tasks
Stages and groups of stages, as well as swimlanes and groups of swimlanes, can be rearranged using drag&drop.
Movement of stages/swimlanes between groups is permitted when the values match the group and if the groups are not related to a directory.
Stages and stage groups
with the "Left without swimlanes"/"Right without swimlanes" setting can only be moved within the specified side.
When the last remaining stage is dragged out of a group of stages, the empty group is automatically deleted. This same behavior applies when the last swimlane is removed from a group of swimlanes.
All modifications made on the Kanban board - including task reordering within cells - are automatically saved by the System with no manual confirmation required. Changes become immediately visible upon page refresh.
Filtering tasks
Task filtering can be performed using:
the search field in the control panel
the
filter in the control panel - for filtering task cards across all cells of the Kanban board;
the filtering option available in the action menu of a Kanban board element - for adding a filter to a specific stage, swimlane, group of stages, or group of swimlanes.
Unlike the filtering configured in
Kanban board settings
, this filtering applies only to the current user and is preserved in the URL (remaining active after page refresh). Kanban boards with configured filtering can be shared via URL.
A Kanban board with configured filters can be shared by sending its URL.
When creating a filter, a modal window will open where you need to set the required filtering conditions and click the "Apply" button:
Filter configuration is based on
attributes located on the task card
and additional attributes specified during
configuration on the "Filtering" tab
.
Filtering by
multiselect attributes
is not supported.
If filtering is applied to all cells, then configuring a filter on a stage, swimlane, group of stages or group of swimlanes will sort the already filtered tasks.
When a filter is applied to all cells on the Kanban board, the icon in the control panel will be replaced:
.
If filtering or
sorting
is configured on a Kanban board element, there will be a corresponding visual indicator. To modify this filtering, select the "Filtering" option in the context menu; to reset it — click on
:
If the Kanban board has at least one configured filter, a dropdown list becomes available next to the filter icon in the control panel, offering the following options:
Configure/edit the filter for all task cards;
Reset the filter for all task cards (if previously configured);
Reset all user-configured filters (configured using the
icon in the control panel and on stages, swimlanes, groups of stages and groups of swimlanes).
Task sorting
By default, all users apply the sorting configured in the
Kanban board settings
. A user can customize sorting according to their needs and preferences using:
the
sorting option in the control panel – to sort task cards across all cells of the Kanban board;
the sorting option available in the action menu of a Kanban board element – to configure sorting on a specific stage, swimlane, group of stages, or swimlanes.
A Kanban board with configured sorting can be shared by sending its URL.
When creating a sorting, a modal window will open for selecting the attributes to sort by and the sorting direction:
Sorting configuration is based on
attributes located on the task card
and additional attributes specified during
configuration on the "Sorting" tab
.
The order of sorting can be changed using the
icon via Drag&Drop. To delete a sorting, use the
button.
Sorting configured on a specific element takes priority over sorting configured via the Kanban board control panel.
Sorting configured on stages takes priority over sorting configured on swimlanes.
When sorting is created on a stage, this sorting will apply to all swimlanes of that stage.
When sorting is created on a swimlane, this sorting will apply to all stages of that swimlane.
When sorting is applied to all cells on the Kanban board, the icon in the control panel will be replaced:
.
If sorting or
filtering
is configured on a Kanban board element, there will be a corresponding visual indicators. To modify this sorting, select the "Sorting" option in the context menu; to reset it — click on
:
If the Kanban board has at least one configured sorting, a dropdown list becomes available next to the sorting icon in the control panel, offering the following options:
Configure/edit sorting for all task cards;
Reset sorting for all task cards (if previously configured);
Reset all user-configured sortings (configured using the
icon in the control panel and on stages, swimlanes, groups of stages, and swimlanes).
1
. WIP-limits (Work In Progress — the number of tasks in progress) is a project management tool that limits the number of tasks being performed simultaneously.
